documents.text:
--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-06 ---

Visit 1 clinical encounter for SB-P003.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 125/77, heart rate 76, weight 64.1 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 7.57 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 19.8 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 29.81 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.34 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.69 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.15 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-06-27 ---

Visit 2 clinical encounter for SB-P003.

On exam, BP is 131/71, pulse 85, wt 70.9 kg. Patient appears comfortable, no distress noted.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 7.03 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 18.7 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 27.62 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.0 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.29 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.18 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging reveals meaningful tumor shrinkage consistent with partial response (PR). Target lesion regression of ~40.8%.

PSA now 3.36 ng/mL — decrease 40.8% from initial value.

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 3 | Date: 2025-07-18 ---

Patient SB-P003 presents for scheduled cycle 3 visit.

VS: 109/68 | HR 70 | Wt 73.1 kg. Patient comfortable, no distress noted.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 6.01 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 24.99 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 29.15 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.05 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 7.28 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.22 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current regimen. Follow up in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-08 ---

Patient did not present for scheduled visit 4. Attempted phone contact — patient's family member confirmed patient was unwell.

--- Visit 5 | Date: 2025-08-29 ---

Routine protocol visit 5. Patient ID: SB-P003.

VS: 126/90 | HR 85 | Wt 82.9 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 4.9 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 21.99 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 31.11 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 12.17 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5]
  - WBC: 6.87 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.16 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 6 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-09-19 ---

SB-P003 — Cycle 6, Day 1 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 125/83, heart rate 76, weight 73.8 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 4.23 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 21.28 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 29.92 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.33 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.55 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.25 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Imaging: Target lesion measurements stable — neither sufficient shrinkage for PR nor increase for PD. Classified as stable disease (SD) per RECIST.

Serum PSA: 5.67 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 0.1% compared to baseline.

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 7 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-10 ---

Visit 7 clinical encounter for SB-P003.

Vitals: BP 143/71 mmHg, HR 63 bpm, Weight 77.4 kg.

New AE: Headache. Severity: moderate (Grade 2). Onset: day 129. Resolved by day 133. Relatedness: unlikely. Treatment was held pending resolution. Dose interruption documented.
New AE: Vomiting. Severity: mild (Grade 1). Onset: day 130. Resolved by day 134. Relatedness: possible. No dose modification required.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 5.4 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 23.02 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 30.53 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.35 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.14 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.28 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Plan: Continue therapy per protocol with supportive medications. Return for cycle 8 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-10-31 ---

SB-P003 — Cycle 8, Day 1 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 138/61, heart rate 57, weight 84.8 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 4.33 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 25.27 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 32.45 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.25 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 6.65 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.23 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Concerning findings on restaging: tumor growth of 27.8%. Progressive disease per RECIST criteria.

PSA now 7.25 ng/mL — increase 27.8% from initial value.

Plan: Supportive care as needed. Return for cycle 9 in 3 weeks.
